Cell.Data: You can't replace a Quest Item
You can't replace a Quest Skill
The story ends here… for now!

Thank you for playing Wolcen : Lords of Mayhem! Due to the alpha state of the game, the main story doesn't go further for now and will be extended and improved with time. Those who seek challenge can now have access to the Randomly Generated Dungeons in Amarth, and the Daily Dungeon feature. Those who don't can still use the Housing feature in Dhur. Or you can also explore the open world or create a new character and start over!
Welcome to Wolcen : Lords of Mayhem. You can disable those tutorial messages in the Game Settings. The golden arrow on your minimap points to your next objective, but feel free to explore. Have fun!
Pressing the Dodgeroll key ([SPACE] by default) will allow you to avoid traps and imminent attacks. Dodging requires Stamina.
Water is a key element of elemental interactions. Fire, Lightning and Frost effects are affected by water and rain in many ways. Take this into consideration when using your Spells.

You just obtained your first Spell Book. Open your inventory and right-click on the item to learn the Spell. You can't read the Book of a Spell you already know, but you can sell or exchange it for Experience in town.

Your character uses Umbra and Rage to inflict Damage. Rage is generated when hitting enemies with Weapons and spending Umbra, and empties itself with time. Umbra regenerates itself with time and when Rage is spent. Spells require either Rage or Umbra in order to be used.
Ahead awaits a strong enemy. Don't hesistate to switch between your Spells and Melee attacks to defeat him. Good luck!
Exploring the open world will often lead you to hidden treasures and unique rewards.
In Wolcen, you can rotate the camera around you anytime. It's sometimes useful for finding hidden paths or rewards. Just hold the middle mouse button to rotate the camera.
Find a way to open the locked door
Find your way to the exit

My name is Leon. We felt the activation of this ancient site all the way from Amarth, and I was sent here to check what happened. You should come with me to the village, our leader will want to meet you.
Seeing that you escaped the Republic's prison makes me even more curious, but we'll discuss that later. For now, just stand on the Waypoint to reach Amarth, to the North-West.

Eh, close enough. The Ravencrest moutain. I guess it's your first time with waypoints, right? Don't worry, soon you'll be able to go precisely where you want to. For now, just follow the road straight ahead to Amarth.
Ah, Leon. I'm glad to see you are back without a scratch. Who is this newcomer?
We met near the ancient Waypoint. It got reactivated, most probably by this person's presence. And the old prison has been destroyed.
Good riddance, at least they won't follow you here. But we should send a few brothers to guard the Waypoint as a precaution.

As for you my new friend, welcome to Amarth. Feel free to rest here, you seem exhausted. Take these few coins and grab an armor at our merchant's store. You can also talk to Torvus next to the Arena if you want to train.
Look who's coming my way hoping for free merchandise. Let things be clear : I received orders to give you a few items. But they're the last you'll ever get for free. And they're dirty.
But don't hesitate to check our other items! They're all really nice and shiny and better than this crap or the ones you'll find on your own. Cash up front, no discount.
Talk to Leon when you are ready
Find the lost Templar in Evergrave
Kill the Grave Keeper at the end of the Crypt
Good to see you again. Escaping the Republic's prison must have been hard for you, but we'll discuss that later. Meanwhile, I need you to help me for a specific task.

One of our members went to see our Alchemist and should have come back already. He must have crossed the village of Evergrave. I am sending Brother Leon to check on him, but he may need backup. I want you to accompany him.
He told me you defeated a Skull Crusher, so it should be a simple routine for you, but be careful as a dark power has begun to spread across the area. At night, the Undead are everywhere.
You can depart whenever you want, but please don't wait too long. The safety of our brothers is my priority. Talk to Leon when you are ready to go.
Are you ready for this dangerous rescue mission? Amon's knows I am ! I really need to successfully handle this one…
Actually, my navigation skills are pretty bad… Would you mind leading the way? I'm right behind you!

If I recall correctly, Evergrave should be east of here. We have to follow the eastern road to Dhur, then turn to the north at the first crossroads. It may not be the quickest way, but it's the safest.
Be careful, dark creatures are everywhere once you've passed Amarthian doors. But this should be easy if we fight together.
This seems familiar, Evergrave should be close. Or maybe not. I'm sorry, I'm really bad at this.
Hurry, this blood trail seems to lead inside this old church. I hope my brother is not hurt!
It looks like a shortcut to the village. Well done! You are really better than me at this.
Look, a direction sign. I think we should be going North now.
*Coughs* Leon, by Amon! I'm glad you're here. You'll have to help me stand, I'm injured. But first we need to take care of this creature at the end of the crypt…
He's the keeper of the Undead, and we can't let him get out so close to Amarth, and so close to our brothers out there.
Right. Stranger, you'll have to kill this foe in the next room, I'll stay near Brother Henoch to protect him. It should not be too powerful, but be careful. Good luck!
Thanks. My knee is badly injured, and I still need to check on Seren. I can't go back to Amarth without her.
Don't worry. We'll take care of this.
I know I can't ask you more than you've already done for me stranger, but could you check on our Alchemist? She missed the last meetings at Amarth and we need her for something important.
She lives in Silvercrown, a giant tree east of here, not far from the Evergrave. I need to bring Henoch back to Amarth, his wounds need to be healed.
The path should be safe, but you should be careful with Seren, she can be a little… unpredictable. Thanks again for your help.
Oh and take this potion, you'll need it to survive the darker evil that lie in those parts.
Great, someone helpful coming my way. Your timing is perfect! I just need you to gather two… no, three more ingredients for this potion. They're not hard to find. Quick, off you go!
… I don't have time to listen to your stories. See? I'm cooking right now! Besides, I don't know you. So we'll talk when my potion is ready, not before.
Listen, this is super important, okay? The Corruption has spread this way and this potion is the only way to stop it. So you'll tell me your life story later, when we're safe.
I'll need one Grave Digger's heart, but you may have to descecrate a few graves to lure him out of his lair. Best spot to start is the village of Evergrave. You probably saw it on your way here.

Then, I'll need a few Arctic roots from the Hailstone Bay, North-West from here. You should find them near the Hailstone lake, but be careful when picking them up, they only grow in dangerous areas with ridiculously low temperatures.
And last but not least, one unspoiled Pithus egg! That the most important ingredient of all, okay? I know where you can find Pithuses, in a nearby cave to the North, in the Hailstone fields.
I'm pointing all three on your map, if you get lost. And take this before you go, you seem a little unprepared for what is waiting for you out there. Off you go my little warrior!
Gather Arctic roots in the Hailstone bay : %1 / %2
Bring the roots back to Seren
Fantastic! I hope you picked fresh ones. Ha! Fresh, get it? Because they're fro... Nevermind. They'll do great in the potion, thanks!
Destroy enough tombs to lure a Grave Digger
Kill the Grave Digger and take out his heart
Bring the heart back to Seren
Hooray, you found the heart! I hope the Grave Digger didn't give you too much trouble, they get angry when they're disturbed. You know, being dead and all.
Find the lair of the Pithuses in the Hailstone fields
Bring the egg back to Seren
Oh, thank you, a genuine Pithus egg! It's so cute, it will do perfectly. I only regret you didn't bring me two or three more now that I see it, but I suppose it will suffice.
Reach and destroy the Corrupted Node
Protect Seren while she's fixing the potion
Now that I have the heart and the roots I can finish the mixture, And the egg will do perfectly in my omelet, I'm starving!
… What? Don't you know Pithuses eggs are good for the digestive system and rather expensive? You wouldn't have brought me one if I told you I wanted to eat it.
But that's not important! The important thing is, I achieved the potion! Tadaaaa! With this spilled over your sword, axe, hands or whatever, you can destroy the Corrupted Nodes!
So enough talking, and let's test this in real conditions. The nearest Node is not far from here, to the east. I'll meet you there, don't make me wait!
This is the Node, go ahead, strike it! But be careful, that thing will react to our presence, probably in a bad way.
What? Did it just heal? Keep on hitting it, I'm sure we're close to destroying it!
No, wait! No no no, it doesn't work! Why does it not work? Oh, I think I forgot something in the potion!
… Yes, very funny. You'll laugh at me later! I am going to fix this, but I need you to protect me! Hold on, this shouldn't be long!
That's it, it's working! Go ahead, destroy that thing now!
Ah! That was something, right? But now the potion's working, I couldn't be happier! Hooray! And you can now destroy all the Corrupted Nodes you'll encounter in your journey, isn't that wonderful?

Oh, but most importantly, you can now hit the Corruption where it counts : the Corrupted Hearts. You'll find one East of here, beyond the Corrupted fields, in the ruins of the Ashenrock temple. You need to kill it in order to definitely reduce the spread.

This is the last task I need you to do for me. Then, we will talk about your story. Meet me at Silvercrown when you've finished, I really need to write down all that happened for my research, or they'll never believe me. Good luck!
Oh, and choose a potion from my personal supply, as a special thank you for protecting me. It will be useful wherever you go. But take just one, okay? It's not like you saved the world or anything.
Ahh! You have to protect me, now I have to start over again! Don't let them hurt me!
Reach the Corrupted Heart in the Ashenrock temple
Defeat all the enemies spawned by the Corrupted Heart
I knew it! You're back in one piece! I'm so happy!
Now that we know how to fight the Corruption, we must tell the Templars of Amarth. Their help will come handy in the fights to come. Meet me there as soon as you can.
And here's a small reward. It's not much, but I know you'll make a good use of it.
Destroy the Corrupted Heart that blocks the passage to the Ravengarde Fortress
Defeat all the enemies spawned by the Corrupted Heart
Seren told me what you managed to do. I'm impressed, and hope is now a viable option for us. It is now time I tell you something about us, Templars of Amon, and trust you with the truth.

Like you, we defied the Republic by refusing to let them use our powers and now they are chasing us. In order to stop them, we put all our resources into the finding of the lost heir to our king, so that Alia can have a true ruler again.
And believe it or not, the Necromancer to the South is connected to the heir in one way or another. We know this, thanks to our dear Seren who was… connected to him too, once.
That's alright Father, you can say it. I was his apprentice, and found that weird journal speaking of those things. But don't worry I'm fine now and totally not a necromancer!

The journal you seek must be with him, in Ravengarde. But most importantly, you must kill him when you have the chance. He is responsible for all those Undead lying around, and we really need to make the roads safer.

Another Corrupted Heart blocks the way, but now you know how to destroy them, right? After that, there should be two switches to unlock the bridge, then you'll have access to his underground castle. That's all I can tell you, besides wishing you good luck.
Use the first switch to unlock the way to the Ravengarde Fortress
Use the second switch to unlock the way to the Ravengarde Fortress
Roam Ravengarde to find the Necromancer
Flee, while you still can. Laran, the Necromancer, is already far away from here. You've come too late. The Bones Lord has been left behind by its master, and if he finds you he will …
Do not care about me, wherever I go the cultists of Mictlan will find me. I cannot hide... I'd rather die here. Please, get away from here, do not look behind.
Father, look. Our hero's back! Hooray!
Great. I guess the Necromancer's dead... What? You only killed his servant and he ran away? That's nothing good to hear… But I am glad you came back alive.
And with his primary officer dead, the roads surrounding us will get safer with time. Seren, do you know where Laran could have gone? This thing about Mictlan's cultists worry me.

I did meet a few unsavory characters once in Dhur stronghold, but they won't be that easy to find. And cultists of Mictlan should not be tread lightly with. But if Laran can move, that means he has managed to transfer into a new shell and that we do not have much time.
Friend, you should go to Dhur to the East and lead your investigation. On our side, we'll try to find more information on the cultists. I hope the citizens of Dhur are safe, I have a bad feeling...
Anyway, I forgot to thank you for killing the Bones Lord. Take this, I hope this reward will satisfy you.
Kill the Flesh Hunters chief and cut out his head
Bring the head back to Dhur's guard
Wait! I don't recognize your face, and we do not accept strangers in the mighty stronghold of Dhur. What business do you want with our people? What problems will you bring forth if I let you in?

You know what? I don't even care about your life story. If you want to pass, you'll have to do me a favor. Is this fair? Probably not. Will I ask you anyway? I think so. I'm the mighty guard of the only access door to the greatest city of Alia!

So if you want the doors to open, you'll have to kill the chief of the Flesh Hunters, a savage tribe that live South of here, in the Thornwood forest. The bridge they claim was the best way for marchants convoys to enter in the city, through the Eastern door.

Now that they occupy the bridge and scare the travellers, the only way in the city is through this door, and as you can see, all those stairs don't make the transportation of goods very easy. You bring me the head of their chief, they scatter in the wind, I open the door. Do we have a deal?

Woh! Is that a human head? Are you insane? I said to bring me his head, figuratively speaking! I would have known if he was dead anyway, no need to dismember a body and bring this disgusting thing here! Gosh... you're one mad person.

Well, just toss it in the river. I don't need rotting heads on my desk. You've done what I asked anyway, so I'll open the gate. But remember that we're watching you, and please try not to decapitate anybody while you're in the city.

Ha ha! You think you can defy me? Nobody is stronger than the great Bearclaw ! I'm going to drown the ground with your blood and eat your guts, then I'll wear your skin on my shoulders like a trophy... And we'll know who is strong, then.
In this tutorial, you can discover many different weapon type and practice with them to find the one that suits you the best.
Try the different weapons available on the practice target or leave the arena
Good morning, friend. If you want to train yourself, we can start with a quick overview of different weapon types you'll encounter.
There is no challenge here, just practicing and learning how to manipulate different combat techniques.
You'll find a few weapons on the racks here, you can select the one you want then try to hit the straw man over there. You can exit through the door whenever you see fit.

Shields are robust and give you a chance to block all incoming attacks in front of you. Hitting with your shield is also an effective way to stun enemies. But most of the hits you will perform will hit a single enemy.
You can pair a Shield with any one-handed weapon, sword, dagger or mace, and I even knew someone who could wield one with a Broadsword in the other hand. But this requiered a tremendous strength.

Crossbows are our main ranged weapons and are very efficient against hordes of enemies, since you can shoot several bolts at once with it if you know the right technique. But for now, try hitting the target from a long distance.
Crossbows are great for mobility, since shotting with them is fast and you have time to see the danger come. Paired with specialized ammunitions, this can be a really deadly weapon.
But be careful with them, as they will generate Rage on hit just like Melee weapons, thus preventing you from casting Umbra-based Spells too often. You need to find the right attack pace.

Ah, Daggers! Those are the fastest and most deadly weapons in my opinion, since they often have high critical chance and are great for inflicting Bleeding damage or Poison due to their incredible attack speed.
But as you probably have guessed, they don't inflict much damage on their own and thus are not my first choice against a very armored foe. But they are a reliable option in most cases.

I see you like heavy weapons, right? Warhammers are the most powerful weapons we own, along with Broadswords and Battleaxes. They have a wide attack angle, meaning that you can strike many targets in one move.

They are powerful and will probably stun your opponents, but they are also very slow, and the hardest weapons to handle in my opinion. The same goes for other two-handed weapons, they're quite technical for a rookie like you.
I wouldn't tread with this staff lightly if I were you, those artifacts are true death machines. You can find magic staves of all main elements, and even specialized staves like Umbra or Shadow ones.

They all have different rythms and effects, but they generally throw sequences of magical projectiles and have an average damage rate. But their main perk is that they don't generate Rage on use, so they're great for wizards who want to recover their forces between Spells.

Ah great, a newcomer! Please, tell me when you want challenge and rewards. I can summon a portal to the Deeps and send you to a sure death if ever you wished to. This is a great way of training yourself, but don't get greedy or you'll never come back.
Yes, this should do. Here, take the keys. This is your house now. But please take care of it.

Come on, come closer! Ladies and gentlemen, are you thrill-seekers who want to prove themselves? Do you crave for intense sensations and desperately need to compete with others? Then the Daily Dungeon will brace you in its arms and squeeze you until you're happy and satisifed! And come see mee often, as the challenge changes everyday!
Talk to the guard in Dhur to access the Arena

Hey, you! You seem like you could use a little training and maybe earn a few coins, am I right? If you are not afraid of tough fights and wish to find glory, then please step forward and enlist as an official Gladiator in our Arena. Only the great city of Dhur offers such a beautiful sport!
